# 1. Create a 5 by 10 matrix of random integers
```{r}
set.seed(1005937774)
rand_int <- sample.int(100, size = 50, replace = FALSE)
rand_matrix <- matrix(rand_int, nrow = 5, ncol = 10)
rand_matrix
```

# 2. Define column names cond1, cond2, cond3, cond4, cond5, ctrl1, ctrl2, ctrl3, ctrl4, ctrl5
```{r}
colnames(rand_matrix) <- c("cond1", "cond2", "cond3", "cond4", "cond5", "ctrl1", "ctrl2", "ctrl3", "ctrl4", "ctrl5")
rand_matrix
```

# 3. Define row names as gene1, gene2, gene3...
```{r}
rownames(rand_matrix) <- c("gene1", "gene2", "gene3", "gene4", "gene5")
rand_matrix
```

# 4. Compute the fold change for each gene
```{r}
cond <- rand_matrix[ , 1:5]
cont <- rand_matrix[ , 6:10]
fold_change <- log2(cond/cont)
fold_change
```
